p: Previous studies from South America have also identified changes in the ORF1ab, E, and nucleocapsid genes, occurring at the level of specific oligo-binding sites which could negatively impact adequate viral identification. Despite the relative conservation of the E-gene [ 30], as also shown by our study, variants associated with a C-to-T transition at position 26,340 have shown to affect testing performance in commercial assays, such as the cobas Â® SARS-CoV-2 (Roche) [ 34]. The fact that this mutation has emerged independently on various occasions adds a word of caution when relying uniquely on this target region, given the latent possibility of mutations that could potentially limit probe binding and impair amplification [ 34].
